Rn its 70% drama 20% BL and 10% Volleyball.

Well finally we have a storyline, which does not resemble much of Haikyu, but even then, I can find the similiarity between, the coaches drama, Ukai being away and The coach of seiin being mentally away. But still bearable. Hopefully, this is the start of something original and not a modded rip off.

The sports anime genre may not be for you if that's how far you're reaching for similarities.
I say sports cause there tend to be multiple anime series surrounding a single sport.
There are many for baseball and basketball for example.
You wont really enjoy them if this is how you think about it.

Well I'm quite sorry then, this anime should not have been released right a week later haikyu was finished. I've watched enough sports from old to new, from OneOuts to KnB to SlamDunk etc etc to know there are many facets of each game which can be explored, hell, I've been basketball shooting gaurd for 14yrs, but it's pure blasphemy if you are telling me that this is all new and fresh story. I'm sorry as much I despise to be super critics like AoT twitterati, this one is a modded rip off. They did not even allow the viewers to bask Haikyuus glory, then went ahead and straight up aired it 1 week later which quite literally deletes the only defense about finding similarities. Had they not released it right after it, maybe it would have felt good to have it all back, but now, oh no. Maybe there are people like yourself, good sire, who don't really care even if story is plagiarised through a gray zone, to legally make it seem fresh which makes you enjoy story even if they are similar with different characters and similar facets most people can't. Even if most people do, atleast I don't. And I again emphasise, there are enough facets in each game to be explored and animated for it to not just feel fresh but actually be F R E S H, and this anime is failing quite well at that atleast till the previous episode, but again not giving up on an anime is what a good viewer should do and that's what I will do. I will keep on watching and see how different it is. Good day to you, good sir.

I am not telling you that this is a new and fresh story, on that same note I also do not think this is a Haikyuu rip off.
Sure, they may not have allowed the viewers to bask in the Haikyuu glory, I feel like I did the same to myself watching Dive!! right after catching up with Free!
I also agree that the setters are very similar. This anime could have given that personality to another character besides the setter but we always need that cold and aloof character along with their "genki" partner lead, something extremely common in many anime outside of sports.( Naruto with Sasuke and Naruto, Free! with Haru and Makoto, KnB with Kuroko and Kagami, etc etc etc)
But at least this genki main dude is no Hinata, he gives me more Asahi vibes in his volleyball skills if anything.

Man, I just so so so wished they would not do this early, cause deep in my heart, I know in Haikyuu, everyone loves volleyball to the point where they are Vball junkies, and here we have just a couple of Vball junkies and rest are in the process of falling for it and more like, they'll fall in love with their team. But damn, their release date is just.. just not letting me love it to it's potential, everything is just getting related to Haikyu, and I cannot stop it. Man f them studio, they could have been so much better if for a spring relase.

I completely agree and it will be ok man.
I just hope that if they do go the drama route, they flesh it out nicely cause so far it all seems pretty superficial.
Neva loses!! He's a winner! Winnerrrr winner chicken dinner!!!
